text:
example an ANT_ARGS with the following fails under cygwin
-lib C:\ProgramFiles\junit3.8.1\junit.jar

while the following will work

-lib C:/ProgramFiles/junit3.8.1/junit.jar

I presume that when the startup script is constructing the execution string, it
exposes this directly to the shell which in turn considers the backslashes as
escapes
creator: daniel.santos@pobox.com
jkf@apache.org
text:
ANT_ARGS are specified as being command line arguments, so the treatment of this
argument is indeed as if would have been specified on the command line. And
indeed under cygwin the \ will escape the next character.

There is no possibility work around this, and it is also doubtful whether it is
desirable to work around this, as in that case the ANT_ARGS do not behave like
command line arguments anymore.

Please define ANT_ARGS as -lib "C:\ProgramFiles\junit3.8.1\junit.jar" if you
want the same option to work under both windows and cygwin

creator: daniel.santos@pobox.com

On win XP with or without cygwin this seems to be portable between dos and
cygwin when you enclose the path name in quotes (not the entire ANT_ARGS).
like:

-lib "C:\ProgramFiles\junit3.8.1\junit.jar"
